description: From Middle English forthfaren, from Old English forþfaran (“to go forth, depart”), equivalent to forth- +‎ fare. Related to forþfaru (“departure”) and forþfōr (“departure, death”).

verbs.description: forthfare (third-person singular simple present forthfares, present participle forthfaring, simple past and past participle forthfared)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To go forth; go away; depart; journey.
examples: [...] with great-hearted Christians fighting for each other instead of against each other, all just forthfaring unitedly for the Christianizing of the world, [...]

description: From Middle English forthfare, from Old English forþfaru (“a going forth, departure”).
